benchmark_details.name: FD-Bench: A Full-Duplex Benchmarking Pipeline Designed for Full Duplex Spoken Dialogue Systems
benchmark_details.overview: We present a comprehensive FD benchmarking pipeline utilizing LLMs, TTS, and ASR to address the gap in evaluating Full-Duplex Spoken Dialogue Systems (FDSDS) during user interruptions.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective is to provide a comprehensive evaluation method for FDSDS focusing on their capabilities to handle user interruptions and maintain robustness.

data.source: Simulated speech conversations generated using LLMs and TTS systems.
data.annotation: Automatically generated based on simulated dialogues.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated using outputs from the ASR systems and evaluation from LLM scoring.
methodology.interpretation: High scores in SRR and SIR indicate better handling of interruptions by the systems.
methodology.baseline_results: Results reported for three models: Moshi, Freeze-omni, and VITA-1.5 under various interruption types.
methodology.validation: Evaluated in a server-client architecture simulating real-time interactions.
